intro: Ranunculus laevis, commonly known as the smooth buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves with a smooth, waxy surface. Its flowers have five to eight sepals that resemble petals, and it produces small, greenish-yellow fruits. Ranunculus laevis prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
